title: Graph of electric field magnitude on x-axis

content.question: Two charged particles, each with a charge of +q, are located along the x-axis at x = 2 and x = 4, as shown above. Which of the following shows the graph of the magnitude of the electric field along the x-axis from the origin to x = 6?

choices.label: Choice A is a graph with E on the vertical axis and x on the horizontal axis. There are evenly spaced tick marks along the horizontal axis from 1 to 6. In choice A, there are dashed vertical lines at tick marks 2 and 4. To the left of the line at 2, there is a curve starting on the vertical axis and increasing and concave up, with an asymptote at 2. Between the lines at 2 and 4, there is a curve that has an asymptote at 2 and is decreasing and concave up, reaches a minimum at 0 at 3, then is increasing and concave up until an asymptote at 4. To the right of the line at 4, there is a curve with an asymptote at 4 that is decreasing and concave up.

Choice B is a graph with E on the vertical axis and x on the horizontal axis. There are evenly spaced tick marks along the horizontal axis from 1 to 6. In choice B, there are dashed vertical lines at tick marks 2 and 4. To the left of the vertical line at 2, there is a curve starting on the vertical axis that is decreasing and concave down, ending on the horizontal axis just before 2. Between the lines at 2 and 4, there is a curve that is concave down everywhere, starting on the horizontal axis just after 2, increasing and reaching a maximum at 3, and then decreasing and returning to the horizontal axis just before 4. To the right of the line at 4, there is a curve that starts on the horizontal axis just after 4 and is increasing and concave down.

Choice C is a graph with E on the vertical axis and x on the horizontal axis. There are evenly spaced tick marks along the horizontal axis from 1 to 6. In choice C, there are dashed vertical lines at tick marks 2 and 4. To the left of the line at 2, there is a curve starting on the vertical axis and increasing and concave up until reaching the line at 2. Between the lines at 2 and 4 there is a horizontal line at the height where the first curve reached 2. To the right of the line at 4, there is a curve starting at the height of the horizontal line at 4 that is decreasing and concave up.

Choice D is a graph with E on the vertical axis and x on the horizontal axis. There are evenly spaced tick marks along the horizontal axis from 1 to 6.  In choice D there is a curve that starts on the vertical axis and is decreasing and concave up, reaching the horizontal axis at 2. It is then horizontal along the axis until 4, when it becomes increasing and concave up.

Choice E is a graph with E on the vertical axis and x on the horizontal axis. There are evenly spaced tick marks along the horizontal axis from 1 to 6.  In choice E there is a curve that starts on the vertical axis just above the origin and is increasing and concave up until 2. It then becomes a linearly decreasing line until 4, crossing the horizontal axis at 3. At 4 the curve becomes increasing and concave down, nearly reaching the horizontal axis by 6.

content.answer: Choice A is a graph with E on the vertical axis and x on the horizontal axis. There are evenly spaced tick marks along the horizontal axis from 1 to 6. In choice A, there are dashed vertical lines at tick marks 2 and 4. To the left of the line at 2, there is a curve starting on the vertical axis and increasing and concave up, with an asymptote at 2. Between the lines at 2 and 4, there is a curve that has an asymptote at 2 and is decreasing and concave up, reaches a minimum at 0 at 3, then is increasing and concave up until an asymptote at 4. To the right of the line at 4, there is a curve with an asymptote at 4 that is decreasing and concave up.

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
